title: Welcome to My Dev Blog
content:
This is my very first blog post.
I'll be using this space to share my thoughts, projects, and progress as I grow as a developer.
Expect walkthroughs of personal builds, code snippets, and lessons learned from the field.

title: Driver Mapping: Kernel Mode Exploits
content:
Driver mapping is a technique used to load unsigned kernel drivers by bypassing Windows signature enforcement.
Tools like KDMapper or GhostMapper can exploit vulnerable drivers to execute shellcode at the kernel level.
This method is often used in red teaming and malware analysis to understand privilege escalation tactics.

title: Prefetch: The Swiss Army Knife for Forensics
content:
Windows Prefetch files record executable file launches to speed up boot and application start time.
Forensic analysts use them to determine program execution history, including last run time and file paths.
For example, a prefetch entry for `mimikatz.exe` strongly indicates credential dumping activity.
